newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan dollar closes firmer on tight liquidity.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan dollar closes firmer on tight liquidity.

text.p: The Taiwan dollar finished firmer against its American counterpart on Friday in part because of a tight liquidity in the domestic banking system, dealers said.
The local unit ended at T$27.488 against Thursday's T$27.505 close. Turnover was US$148.5 million.
"The Taiwan dollar was pushed higher by rising short-term interest rates in the banking system," said one dealer.

Liquidity tightened on the delivery of T$30 billion worth of government bonds. The local currenty was weak in early trade to reflect the strength of the U.S. dollar overseas. A range of T$27.47-53 was seen for Saturday. -- Alice Hung (2-5080815)
